instructions: Image titled Disable Touch Accommodations on an iPhone Step 1 1 Open your iPhone's Settings. The Settings icon has gray cogs on it, and it's usually found on one of your home screens, or inside a folder called "Utilities." Image titled Disable Touch Accommodations on an iPhone Step 2 2 Tap . It's the icon with the white cog at the top of the third section of menu options. Image titled Disable Touch Accommodations on an iPhone Step 3 3 Tap . Image titled Disable Touch Accommodations on an iPhone Step 4 4 Scroll to the 3rd section of menu options and tap . Image titled Disable Touch Accommodations on an iPhone Step 5 5 Slide the "Touch Accommodations" switch to the "off" position. Doing so will disable any touch screen settings you might have set up including hold duration, ignore repeat, and tap assistance. The "Touch Accommodations" switch is in the "off" position when it is no longer green. Advertisement
